title: Jam together

title: Estimating software projects: what I’ve learned
description: Estimating project completion is often uncomfortable, but it’s valuable when done right. Here’s what I’ve learned so far about software project estimation.

title: The Treading Water
description: A busy week that caused me to review my task management system. But ended on a high with my first marathon.

title: Conferences and meetups I’ll go to 2023

title: The Chats
description: Roles & responsibilities, a product development model, Human Interface Guidelines, open source, maintenance and communities.

description: When you join a team, you want to know how it works and what it needs you to do. So I've been looking at roles and responsibilities.

title: Bureaucracy, fear, and damaging dogma
description: For all the good that GDS has done, it has also stoked a culture of fear. If we want to innovate government services to make them radically better, we need to address this.

title: The Early Morning Reflection
description: You’ve not heard from me since April, but here’s what I’ve been working on at a very high level.

description: There are hundreds of ways to tell a story, but these formats are useful for getting started with what your team has been working on.

description: The last time I wrote weeknotes was three weeks ago, and these are hanging over my head somewhat – so I want to get something out there to clear brain space.

title: 3 months, no booze
description: A small victory: I’ve not been drunk this year. 3 months without booze. I’m well on my way to achieving my goal of 12 months without alcohol.

title: This idea of AI surpassing human ability is silly

description: Thoughts on how service assessments are like venture-capital investor meetings, and why services should be good regardless of the tech involved.

title: The Down Week
description: Nothing much to share from last week. I was off sick for two days and did little of note at work.

description: Preparing for a service assessment, sharing ideas for discoveries, alphas and betas, plus a lack of greenfield (but that’s OK).

description: Not a bad week to round off 2018, and Winter Solstice is the perfect day to look ahead to 2019. This series hasn't ended yet.

title: The Gift
description: Another sterling week working at pace on important problems. Turning up to work is fun now, it's not just a job. I am incredibly lucky to be able to say that.

title: The Spin Up
description: The most fun I've had at work in a week on record. We're doing work which sings to the vision of GOV.UK, making information about government and services simple, clearer and faster.

title: This is how I work…give or take
description: Dan wanted to see how I work, so here‘s what I do, based on Jukesie’s rip-off of the Lifehacker How I Work series.

title: The Wind Down
description: A four-day week spent closing open loops. Took yesterday off to pack for my holiday which I’m really, *really* looking forward to – especially because it’s supposed to drop to 1°C next week!

title: The Staying of the Course
description: We’re reaching the mid-point of the quarter, so there’s a flurry of things going on. The team is chugging through work at a good pace, but there’s still so much to do if we’re to achieve the objective for our mission.

title: The Comfort of Company
description: People were the best this week. Chats about life and around work, conversations on what we’re doing, and generally making and seeing friends.

title: The Delivery
description: There’s less busyness now that the unconference is out of the way, fewer things flying around my head.

title: The Unconference
description: I’ve pulled out the main lessons from the week, but everything was overshadowed by the unconference – which was a real success.

title: The Launch of Quarter 3
description: A new quarter, a new series. My weeknotes have been an excellent learning aid so far, so I’m carrying on with them.

title: The Finale
description: Lots of time spent in meetings or at events this week, but I did manage to hold one worthwhile team session, at least.

title: The Successful Experiment
description: I’m giving myself a breather. The practice is valuable but isn’t without cost, so this is a little mid-series rest.

title: The Cusp
description: We’re in a liminal zone, a headspace between two periods but only present physically in one. It’s a headtrip to operate that way.

title: The Snorlax
description: This week was mostly planning a convoluted journey in a short space of time, and we’ve still got to fight the beast.

title: The Unity
description: An overarching feeling on oneness this week. A good team lunch, some get-togethers with good folk, and nice vibes all round really.

title: The Boost
description: Another benefit of weeknoting is being able to package up a period of time and conclude your thoughts on it, draw a line in the sand and move on.

title: The Farewell
description: This week I was all over the shop mentally. On Friday I had to just bed down in work with headphones on, but all-in-all it’s been another good week.

title: The Step Up
description: Surprised myself this week by how much I handled it all.

title: The Discovery
description: These weeknotes come to you belatedly, as I was on holiday on Friday and spent the weekend celebrating my 30th with friends.

title: The Reshuffle
description: Reading people’s weeknotes was one of the main inspirations for me to join the Civil Service. So here's me giving it a go.
